common_issues.title: PiecesOS High RAM/CPU Usage and Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users report high RAM/CPU usage with PiecesOS, sometimes reaching 100% CPU. This might be related to internet connectivity. Restarting PiecesOS is a temporary solution. Developers are working on fixes and released version 11.1.0 to address this. Also, users face connection issues due to default port changes in recent versions. Ensure to use the correct port (default 39300 or check logs) to resolve connection problems.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation about PiecesOS Memory and CPU Usage

**Key Points Raised:**

* High memory and CPU usage by PiecesOS, ranging from 2GB to 5GB and 50% to 120% respectively.
* Issues occur even with no models running or when using Live Context.
* Some users suspect the software of mining cryptocurrency.
* Running "Optimize Memory" functionality temporarily reduces RAM usage.

**Problems Identified:**

* High memory footprint, exceeding 2GB even during normal operation.
* Excessive CPU usage, causing system slowdowns and freezes.
* Memory leaks suspected.
* Concerns about unauthorized resource consumption.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Implementing Live Context feature, which adds to resource consumption.
* "Optimize Memory" functionality to unload ML models and free up RAM.
* Release of PiecesOS 11.1.0 replacing database technologies to improve performance.
* Two additional fixes for CPU and memory usage in the works.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* PiecesOS 11.1.0 released, expected to improve memory and CPU usage.
* Further improvements planned for future releases.
* Users encouraged to report continued issues and provide feedback.

**Additional Notes:**

* The high resource consumption is attributed to the software's focus on on-device ML and AI capabilities.
* The developers are actively working on improving performance and optimizing resource usage.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS connection and installation errors
common_issues.description: Users report difficulties installing or connecting to Pieces OS, encountering errors like "Ollama failed to install" or "Connection refused." These issues often stem from sandbox environments, changed default ports, or missing dependencies. Solutions include waiting for patches, verifying port numbers, and consulting documentation for troubleshooting steps.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* User installed Ollama manually and it works from the terminal, but "Ollama failed to install" error persists in Pieces.
* The issue is due to Pieces-OS running in a sandboxed environment that lacks `curl` and can't access globally installed Ollama.

**Problems Identified:**

* Miscommunication about Pieces package confinement led to incorrect dependency handling.
* Sandbox environment prevents Ollama access and proper installation.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Adding `curl` to the snap definition file.
* Developing a patch to allow Ollama usage from the sandbox.
* Infrastructure updates and bug fixes for the patch.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Patch is in development and expected to be rolled out next week (as of January 23, 2025).
* Work on the patch has resumed after infrastructure updates are complete (as of January 28, 2025).

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue remains present in the latest available version of Pieces-OS.
* Users are advised to wait for the patch to be released.
